snippet: The conviction of a prominent member of the Satmar Hasidic community for sexual abuse sends a strong message to the ultra-Orthodox Jewish neighborhood, which has shielded abusers.
abstract: Editorial praises Brooklyn District Attorney Charles Hynes for prosecuting and winning conviction, first of its kind, against Nechemya Weberman, prominent member of Williamsburg's tightly knit ultra-Orthodox Jewish community; holds no religious institution has right to shield its child abusers from civil prosecution.
lead_paragraph: The conviction of a prominent member of the Satmar Hasidic community for sexual abuse sends a strong message to the ultra-Orthodox Jewish neighborhood, which has shielded abusers.
